intro: Scorzonera muricata, commonly known as the rough scorzonera, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and foliage with a rough, hairy texture. The plant produces yellow flowers that bloom in the summer months, and its roots are often used in traditional medicine. Scorzonera muricata thrives in rocky or dry soils and is adapted to withstand periods of drought. Its unique appearance and ecological role make it an interesting subject for botanical study.
